summary: Helen Whitney Watriss was an Assistant Editor for the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Payroll documents from November 1978 and February 1979 list her position and salary. She was employed by the HSCA during the period when they were actively investigating the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. The documents provide administrative details related to her employment within the committee.
significance: Helen Whitney Watriss's significance lies in her role as an Assistant Editor for the HSCA, indicating her involvement in the research, documentation, and reporting processes of the committee's investigation into the JFK assassination. While the documents primarily focus on her employment details, her position within the HSCA places her as a participant in one of the most significant investigations related to the assassination.
